result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina L. Hudack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Kristina L. Hudack was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristina L. Hudack is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Kristina L. Hudack was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution to be determined.  Restitution hearing scheduled for 3-30-2017 at 1:15 p.m.

Huber release granted, hours and conditions to be set by Sheriff's Dept. where jail sentence will be served.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
Cognitive behavior and anger management counseling as directed by DOC agent.
Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

Minutes Filed from JUry Trial

Afternoon session of the jury trial. Defendant Kristina L. Hudack in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  SP Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin, with State's Agent, Deputy Dave Dawson.  Jurors brought into the courtroom at 1:30 p.m.
*Donna Hudack sworn and questioned by SP Poquette; informs of activities of 10-03-2015/10-04-2015; was at Kristina Hudack's home for the weekend; reports how much alcohol witness consumed; got Kristina a beer after she came back from Mr. Hartung's home.  Cross by Atty Tjader; don't know how much Kristina Hudack had to drink after coming home from Mr. Hartung's home; she was covered in blood and very upset; explains house layout.  No Re-direct by SP Poquette.  Witness is released from subpoena.
*Billie Robbins sworn and questioned by SP Poquette; explains education and work experiences; exhibit #4 marked, Court rec'd with no objections; have tested approx. 1500 samples for alcohol; if something was wrong with the sample, it would be noted within case notes; explains process used for testing samples; exhibit #5 marked, witness identifies the exhibit, results 0.115 shown on the report, draw was 10-04-2015 at 06:30 a.m., Court receives exhibit #5 with no objections.  Witness explains how to determine alcohol content for a previous time, explains difficulties with this calculation; witness calculates to determine alcohol content back to 2:20 a.m. on 10-04-2015, result is .151 to .260 with average .169, for Ms. Hudack this calculation would indicate she had approx. 5 standard drinks.  Cross by Atty Tjader; witness explains that the calculation is based on no add'l alcohol after 2:20 a.m.  No re-direct by SP Poquette, asks witness remain under subpoena for possible rebuttal testimony.  Court indicates this witness may remain in the courtroom.
State rests, may use rebuttal.  Break taken at 2:12 p.m.
Atty Tjader ready to proceed w/Case in Chief, client will not be testifying; Court discusses the constitutional rights of this decision w/Ms. Hudack; Court satisfied Ms. Hudack is making this decision K&V.  
Jury brought in at 2:31 p.m.  Defense is ready to begin.
*William John Hood sworn and questioned by Atty Tjader; rec'd phone call from Don Hartung 10-04-2015; both Kristina and Don were injured by the time he arrived; brought Kristina home, somewhere between 1-2 a.m.; Kristina's friend poured all a mixed drink; Kristina was drinking heavily; was at her home for about 10 min. then went back to Don's; spoke with police at Don's.  Cross by SP Poquette; have talked w/Atty Tjader twice about this case; have not made a statement to police; Kristina was drinking a clear booze, maybe vodka; she had one drink in the 10 min. he was there; convicted of 8 crimes.  Re-direct by Atty Tjader.  Re-Cross by SP Poquette.  Witness is excused and released from subpoena.
Defense rests.  SP Poquette recalls Billie Robbins, Court reminds her she is still under oath; calculates with new info., drinks after 2:20 a.m. included 2 lite beers and one standard drink; new calculation result is .028 to .060 with average of .042.  Cross by Atty Tjader.  No Re-direct.  No further witnesses.  Jury takes a break for Court/Attys to prepare jury instructions.  Attys review the jury instructions prepared by Judge; no objections regarding 100, 103, 115, 140, 145, 147, 148, 155, 157, 160, 170, 190, 195, 200, 205, 300, 2663, 2663C, Closings, 484 Verdicts with modification of removing the counts.  Break for final draft to be prepared.  
Jurors brought into the courtroom at 3:36 p.m.  Jury instructions read to the panel by the Court.  Closing argument of SP Poquette.  Closing argument of Atty Tjader.  Final argument of SP Poquette.  Final jury instruction ready to the panel by the Court.  Jury Bailiff sworn.  Jury out for deliberation at 4:29 p.m.  Court discusses exhibits; no exhibits go back to jury unless they make a request.  Jury reports they have a verdict at 5:31 p.m.   Juror 1013 is Foreperson:  Verdict on OWI - NG   Verdict on PAC - NG; Poll of Jury is unanimous; jurors thanked and excused by the Court.  Court receives the verdicts; directs CoC to enter verdicts; Counts 1 and 4 are dismissed, Ms. Hudack is released from bond.

Morning session of Jury Trial.  Defendant Kristina L. Hudack in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  SP Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's agent is Deputy Dawson.  
Jurors sworn; first 20 jurors called to the box.  Voir dire begins at 9:14 a.m. by the Court.  Voir dire by SP Poquette.  Voir dire by Atty Tjader.  Sm Ctroom questioning of one of the jurors (manual minutes).  Back in the jury ctroom.  Attys take strikes.  Jurors striken thanked and excused.  All Jurors not serving are thanked and excused by the Court.  Panel sworn.  Preliminary instructions read to the jurors by the Court.    Break taken at 10:36 a.m.  Back on the record at 10:57 a.m.  Jurors brought into the ctroom.  Opening statement of SP Poquette.  Opening statement of Atty Tjader.  
*Donald Hartung called by the State; Witness is sworn;  questioned by SP Poquette; witness describes relationship with defendant, describes activities on 10-03-2015; Exhibit #2 marked, Obj. of Atty Tjader, SP Poquette w/d exhibit and continues w/questioning of witness; witness indicates he has not been convicted of any crime.  Cross by Atty Tjader.  No Re-Direct by SP Poquette.  Court releases witness from subpoena. 
*Deputy Dave Dawson sworn and questioned by SP Poquette; describes training and experiences as a Deputy with BCSD; Dispatched to Mr. Hartung's residence on 10-04-2015 at approximately 3:30 a.m., describes home and who was present; Witness identifies defendant; describes Ms. Hudack's demeanor at the home; weapon was found at home, informed Ms. Hudack had access to additional firearms; witness had recorded, exhibit #3 marked, witness indicates what is on the CD-audio recording; Court admits exhibit with no objections; playing begins at 05:31 on the CD through 5:51; Ms. Hudack indicated she took the firearm with her to Mr. Hartung's home to protect herself; witness describes field sobriety testing, he informs of which testing was completed with Ms. Hudack, indicates results of the testing; plays recording between 5:52 and 5:58; 23:23 and 23:35 is played; 28:00 and 28:32 played; 29:10 to 29:20 played; witness's opinion after discussion with her, observing her and testing, was that she was impaired and placed her under arrest for OWI; had a legal blood draw performed on Ms. Hudack at MMC, read informing the accused to Ms. Hudack and observed the blood draw, vial sealed by technician, sealed within the kit and mailed to State Crime Lab.  Cross by Atty Tjader; was at Mr. Hartung's home approx. an hour; waited for backup before going to Ms. Hudack's home; describes Ms. Hudack's activity while in her home; put cuffs on her and removed her from the home; Officer Kern was with Donna Hudack while Ms. Hudack was taken from her home; Officer took the firearm from the back of a pickup truck; gun had been taken out of the truck prior to officer arriving at her home; reports name of medication she indicated she had taken.  Re-direct by SP Poquette; offered medical services, she refused.  No Re-Cross by Atty Hartung.  Witness excused.  Jurors excused for lunch, asked to return by 1:30 p.m.  Court asks Attys to be back from lunch by 12:25 p.m.
Defendant's requested jury instructions
Probation review hearing on February 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Minutes Filed
Jury trial on January 10, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kristina L. Hudack in court with attorney Michele Tjader appearing by telephone with the Court's permission.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion to Amend Pleadings; SP Poquette asks this motion be dealt with first; Atty Tjader has no objections; SP Poquette filed new amended info today; Atty Tjader agrees, and continues NG pleas on these charges; Court grants motion for count 1 and 4.
SP Poquette requests jury instruction pertaining to count 4.  Motion re Prior Offenses, SP Poquette suggests stip to previous convictions and driving history; Atty Tjader agrees, priors will not be mentioned to jurors re driving history; SP Poquette, agreement with OWIs for counting (4), other issue is impeachment of defendant if she takes the stand, recites previous convictions not OWI, propose to this # being 7; Atty Tjader 4 pervious OWI not appropriate for impeachment, others are appropriate for impeachment, but # should be 4; SP Poquette feels other convictions should be 7 by State law; Court, credibility is always an issue when defendant does testify, set the # at 4.  
Motion in Limine, seq. of witnesses, SP Poquette feels appropriate; Atty Tjader agrees; Court reviews his normal procedures/requirements with seq. of witnesses with the Attys.  Issue #3, Statements will be heard by the Court.  Issue #4, Witnesses reviewed; Court indicates amended list filed, SP Poquette will not be using Mr. Kern, but may use all others in the list; Atty Tjader agrees; Court requires Attys to do due diligence and correct anything needed on day of JT.  SP Poquette issue re blood draw stipulation; Atty Tjader agrees.  SP Poquette, indicates they are unable to locate one witness, explains efforts that have been made to the Court; asks for continuance for JT, he saw the defendant drive and could not prove; Atty Tjader objects to continuance; Court talks further with the Attys about this issue, SP Poquette indicates they have been unable to serve witness with a subpoena; Court concerned with the age of the case, no fault of the State, necessary and proper witness and State has relied on this witness on other aspects of this case, grants motion for continuance.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Minutes Filed
Sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from Atty. Tjader
Sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kristina L. Hudack in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in place of Michele Tjader.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Bourg; here today to deal with just the Battery and Disorderly Conduct counts; complying with victim rights.  Not dealing with the OWI count today; waiting for SC decision before going forward with that charge.  Asks sentencing hearing be scheduled for all three counts.  She will make a plea today on count 2, dismissing count 3, but read in for sentencing.  Break taken for attorneys to discuss issues.  
Back on the record at 10:50 a.m.  DA Bourg; State intends to make a recommendation on count 2, but do not want to put recommendation on the record until she makes the plea on count 1.  Rafferty; if she changes her mind on count 1 would not change her plea on count 2.  Comments on the notations on page 1 of the plea questionnaire.  
DA Bourg; have complied with victim rights; victim will make statement at the sentencing.
Defendant; agrees there is an agreement; understands rights, charges and consequences.  Ct; K&V waive constitutional rights.  Court reviews process this case will take with the defendant; she understands there will be a bifurcated plea to charges, and wants to proceed today.  Stipulation to factual basis for count 2; plea of NC entered; Court finds factual basis for count 2, accepts plea and finds defendant G; count 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.  Court reminds parties of the restraining orders now in place.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of appearance for a single hearing

Defendant Kristina L. Hudack in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Bourg; believe there is an agreement on counts 2 and 3; SC case re: issues included in count 1; can dispose of counts 2 and 3, but asks count 1 be left open.
Tjader; SC decision expected by June, 2016; request plea/sentence be scheduled on counts 2 and 3 and remove JT for next week.
Court; informs Atty Tjader that the defendant was in court on a civil matter and that case has been adj. to 05-11-2016; JT for 15CF149 removed from the calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
